NOTICE_DATA.ORIGINAL_CPV: Furniture (incl. office furniture), furnishings, domestic appliances (excl. lighting) and cleaning products

CODIF_DATA.RP_REGULATION: European Economic Area (EEA), with participation by GPA countries
CODIF_DATA.HEADING: 03C02

TITLE.P: Nye Bjørlien skole [the New Bjørlien school] — Fittings

SHORT_DESCR.P: Procurement of fitting to Nye Bjørlien skole [the New Bjørlien School]. The Bjørlien school is a new building that is currently being erected. It is a three parallel grade 1 to grade 7 school for 588 students, 38 teachers and 14 assistants. In addition there is provision for 5 administrative employees plus 1 works technician and cleaning personnel in 3 part time positions. The GFA of the school is: 7 199 m2. The main element in the procurement is to enter into a contract with a service provider in each of the 6 sections in the inventory description (Appendix 3) for delivery and assembly of fittings and equipment. I.e. 1 competition will be implemented per section. Tender offers can be submitted for one or multiple sections. It is a requirement that the tender offers are for complete sections. The tenderer can therefore win one or more of the 6 sections.

TITLE.P: The New Bjørlien school — fittings — Curtains

SHORT_DESCR.P: Delivery and installation of curtain for the New Bjørlien school.

TITLE.P: The New Bjørlien school — fittings — office furniture

SHORT_DESCR.P: Delivery and assembly of office furniture to the New Bjørlien school.

TITLE.P: New Bjørlien school — Fittings — Environmental furniture

SHORT_DESCR.P: Delivery and assembly of environmental furniture to New Bjørlien school.

TITLE.P: New Bjørlien school - Fittings - Special room furniture

SHORT_DESCR.P: Delivery and assembly of special room furniture to the New Bjørlien school.

TITLE.P: New Bjørlien school — Fittings — Chalk boards

SHORT_DESCR.P: Delivery and assembly of chalk boards to the New Bjørlien school.

TITLE.P: The New Bjørlien school — Fittings — Educational furniture

SHORT_DESCR.P: Delivery and assembly of educational furniture to the New Bjørlien school.

SUITABILITY.P: Requirement 1: The company shall be legally registered.
Foreign companies: Registration certificate in a professional register as determined by legislation in the country where the tenderer is established. The documentation must, at a minimum, state:
a. the company's name and registration number;
c. who can act on the company's behalf / bind the company.
Requirement 2: The company shall have its tax and duty payments in order.
Norwegian companies: Tax certificate for VAT and tax, not older than 6 months from the tender deadline.

Foreign companies: Certificate that confirms that the Contractor has fulfilled his obligations in accordance with the legal provisions in the country where the Contractor is established. The certificate shall not be more than 6 months old at the expiry of the tender deadline.

ECONOMIC_FINANCIAL_INFO.P: Requirement 1: The tenderer shall have satisfactory solidity in order to fulfil the contract. Creditworthiness with no requirement for guarantees will be sufficient to meet the requirement.
The company's Annual Financial Statements including notes with the boards and auditor’s report for 2016 and 2017.
Credit rating report, newer than 6 months. The report must be issued by a certified credit rating agency.

TECHNICAL_PROFESSIONAL_INFO.P: Requirement 1: Tenderers are required to have the necessary capacity and competence to fulfil the contract.
The company shall have experience from a minimum of three equivalent assignments during the last 3 years, that are documented by the relevant contracting authority as satisfactory.
Equivalent assignments: Delivery of fittings and equipment to educational buildings.
Overview of the company's relevant deliveries that have been completed during the last 3 years, with the following information provided:
— type of building and size of the available area,
— the Contracting Authority's name and contact information (telephone number and email address). These references can be contacted if needed,
— attestations from previous Contracting Authorities shall be submitted, and as a minimum shall confirm that the tenderer has delivered in accordance with the contract.
The company shall have systems for quality assurance.
The documentation shall be provided in one of the following ways:

— description of the company's routines regarding quality management, with emphasis on quality assurance, resource management, management responsibility, manufacturing process and continuous analysis and improvement,
— if the tenderer holds an ISO 9001:2000 certificate, this can be attached.

TECHNICAL_PROFESSIONAL_MIN_LEVEL.P: Minimum of three (3) equivalent assignments. In the documentation to the requirement, attestations from previous contracting authorities are required be submitted, and must as a minimum confirm that the tenderer has delivered in accordance with the contract.
